title: ‘Time to put a complete end to underworld crimes’ -  Public Security Minister
byline: A comprehensive investigation is being carried out into ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ and his associates, Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala has stated.

title: Thousands protest Israeli siege of Gaza near Venice Film Festival
byline: Thousands of people protested Saturday against Israel’s siege of Gaza on the sidelines of the Venice Film Festival, seeking to move the spotlight from movie drama to real-world trauma.

title: Showers and strong winds expected in parts of the country today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts.

title: Modi reaffirms India’s support for Ukraine peace settlement during call with Zelenskyy
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi reaffirmed his support on Saturday (Aug 30) for a peaceful settlement in Ukraine during a telephone conversation with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Modi’s office said.

title: 28 acres of Kandy Hospital occupied by unauthorised settlers: Director
byline: Dr Iresha Fernando, the Director of the Kandy National Hospital states that out of the 58 acres of land belonging to the hospital, 28 acres have been occupied by unauthorised settlers.

title: Arab-Islamic ministerial committee urges U.S. to reverse visa ban on Palestinian officials
byline: The Ministerial Committee formed by the Joint Arab-Islamic Extraordinary Summit on Gaza on Saturday urged the US administration to “reconsider and reverse” its decision not to grant visas to the Palestinian delegation for the upcoming UN General Assembly.

title: Govt to import 2,000 Cabs for heads of state institutions
byline: Deputy Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government Ruwan Senarath has announced that plans are underway to import 2,000 cab vehicles early next year for the use of heads of government institutions.

title: TikTok says live feature temporarily suspended in Indonesia over protests
byline: Social media platform TikTok announced on Saturday (Aug 30) that it has temporarily suspended its live feature in Indonesia for “a few days” because of violent protests after the death of a man hit by a police vehicle.

title: Three Excise Officers arrested for soliciting Rs. 2 million bribe posing as Narcotics Bureau officers
byline: Three officers attached to the Excise Department in Chankanai have been arrested for allegedly attempting to solicit a bribe of Rs. 2 million while claiming to be officials from the Narcotics Control Bureau.

title: Indonesian police officers involved in operation to apprehend ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ and his group felicitated
byline: Commemorative plaques have been presented to the Indonesian police officers involved in the operation to apprehend Kehelbaddara Padme and his group.

title: Kerala cannabis valued over Rs. 27M seized with five suspects
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized more than 121kg of Kerala cannabis in separate search operations conducted in Vankalei, Mannar and off Delft Island in Jaffna.

title: Xi meets Modi as China and India seek to rebuild ties
byline: Chinese leader Xi Jinping met with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi ahead of the opening of a regional summit on Sunday in Tianjin, in a formal thaw between the two nuclear-armed powers.

title: Man killed in shooting in Wennappuwa
byline: A shooting incident has been reported along the Lake road, adjacent to the Wennappuwa Police Station, at around 10:30 a.m., police stated.

title: Thousands in Australia rally against immigration, government condemns rally
byline: Thousands of Australians joined anti-immigration rallies across the country on Sunday that the centre-left government condemned, saying they sought to spread hate and were linked to neo-Nazis.

title: Celestial Spectacle Awaits Sri Lanka: Rare blood moon to appear for 82 minutes on September 7
byline: A spectacular celestial event is set to light up the skies on September 7, as the Moon undergoes a total lunar eclipse, turning an eerie, deep red for 82 minutes.

title: Three Excise Officers arrested for soliciting Rs. 2M bribe
byline: Three officers attached to the Excise Department in Chankanai have been arrested for allegedly attempting to solicit a bribe of Rs. 2 million while claiming to be officials from the Narcotics Control Bureau.

title: Air India flight returns to Delhi after ‘fire indication’ in engine, aircraft grounded for inspection
byline: An Indore-bound Air India plane made an emergency landing in New Delhi on Sunday after being airborne for over 30 minutes as the pilot received a “fire indication” in the right engine of the aircraft, according to sources.

title: Greta Thunberg embarks on second flotilla to Gaza
byline: Greta Thunberg has rejected accusations of antisemitism as she embarks on her second flotilla to Gaza.

title: Individual arrested over this morning’s Wennappuwa shooting
byline: An individual has been arrested over a shooting incident reported in Wennappuwa earlier today (31), police stated.

title: Israel to halt airdrops ahead of Gaza City offensive as hostage families lash out at Netanyahu
byline: Israel is set to halt airdrops over Gaza City and reduce the entry of relief trucks ahead of a major offensive, a source told CNN, as the Red Cross warned that Israeli plans for mass evacuation were “impossible.”

title: French voice fears over Bayeux Tapestry move to UK
byline: The Bayeux Tapestry, which documents the Norman invasion of England in 1066, will be closed to the public in France from Monday as opposition mounts ahead of its move to London.

title: Air India flight returns to Delhi after ‘fire indication’ in engine
byline: An Indore-bound Air India plane made an emergency landing in New Delhi on Sunday after being airborne for over 30 minutes as the pilot received a “fire indication” in the right engine of the aircraft, according to sources.

title: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake summoned again by CID
byline: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake has been summoned once again to appear before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Foreign Minister to hold key talks with diplomats ahead of UNHRC session
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister, Vijitha Herath, has planned to hold discussions with High Commissioners and Ambassadors in Colombo, human rights activists, scholars, and attorneys in the country ahead of the 60th session of the UN Human Rights Council.

title: India committed to improving ties with China, Modi tells Xi
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said New Delhi was committed to improving ties with China in a key meeting with President Xi Jinping on Sunday, as both leaders discussed the need to expand trade and investment ties against the backdrop of U.S. tariffs.

title: Govt. may seek foreign assistance to fix Nilwala River salinity barrier issue – Minister
byline: Minister Sunil Handunnetti says that if the technical expertise available in the country is insufficient to resolve the issues caused by the irregular construction of the salinity barrier on the Nilwala River in Matara, the government will seek foreign assistance to find a permanent solution.

title: Ex-President Ranil to invite all opposition leaders to UNP’s convention
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has decided to invite all opposition political party leaders to its annual convention.

title: 5 underworld figures including ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ detained under PTA
byline: Five high-profile underworld figures, including ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, who were recently arrested in Indonesia and brought back to the island last night (30), are being detained and interrogated under the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), according to Police Headquarters.

title: Fuel prices reduced
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (31).

title: US judge blocks deportations of unaccompanied migrant children to Guatemala
byline: A federal judge on Sunday issued a restraining order blocking the Trump administration from deporting 10 unaccompanied migrant children to Guatemala after lawyers said the removals would violate U.S. laws.
